She's been doing it for 15 years.There are 500 notifications every hour in the slack chat, mostly about how "Rachel is faking being lactose intolerant."Pure chaos. Even better than the TV show.

I'm on a meditation retreat right now to end the year.No Netflix, no social media, no phone.Nobody within 50 miles to disturb me."But how are you posting on LinkedIn?"Because i've reached an enlightened state of duality.It's called "workitation" = a perfect combination of work and mediation.I'm also in the office working. Doing emails, invoices, networking.But in my mind, I'm in the forest, with nothing but the trees and the beavers.I'm peaceful and calm in a field. But I'm also screaming profanities to my employees down the phone because the company's lost 5% market value.I'm having a full on panic attack. But I'm also zen.You should try workitating. It does wonders for the mind and soul.

A bridge that my construction company built several years ago collapsed.The internal review concluded that it was the fault of one man Arthur Cargill, the project lead.He was grossly negligent, ignored safety warnings and cut costs. What did I do?I hired him to build a second bridge.*Law #13: Failure is the first rung on the ladder of success.*He would've learned so much from that failure that firing him would be a waste of experience.The second bridge also collapsed.I hired him again. Success must be just round the corner now.Not only that, but I also got him to look after my dogs and young infant child while I'm away.How did the third bridge go?Well, we're still yet to find out. Arthur signed off on the safety inspections last week - in record time I might add.Stay tuned.

On Christmas morning, I put an envelope with £100,000 in cash through the letterbox of my next door neighbours.Why did I do it?It was a complete accident. I mixed up their Christmas card with an envelope full of cash.As soon as I realised, I went to retrieve it before they could open it.It was too late. Marvin had already got to it.They were absolutely elated by my random act of kindness.The wife, Jean, said it was life changing money and exactly what they needed to get them through a tough financial year.I realised then that even a silly mistake can have a benefit for someone else.I just said "I'm happy to help. Merry Christmas," and left them to it.I hate Marvin and Jean.If they really needed the money they should have worked harder instead of stealing what's not theirs.Freeloaders.

I'm travelling on a rail replacement bus right now in rural Suffolk.It feels so different than London. It's made me think about the human condition.No one is selling me SaaS.No one is hounding me to invest in their new startup.No one is asking if there are any new job positions for their nephew.I bet no one else on this bus is a CEO.I bet that they've never even heard of LinkedIn.The old woman next to me definitely doesn't know I could buy this whole bus with what's in my wallet.Money, success, capital, none of that seems to matter here.I really do feel like a man of the people.It's utter hell.Get me out of here right now. The lack of wealth and ambition stinks.Where are the intellectual conversations about quarterly reports? Or ROI? I just wish someone would start talking about Blockchain.I can't wait to get back to the City and have someone try to sell me something.

Christmas has become way too Communist.Everyone receives a gift from everybody, regardless of their contribution. Disgusting.This year, we let the free market decide.We pooled all bought presents into a communal pile.These presents could be bought using XmasCoin.You must earn XmasCoin through hard labour: peeling vegetables, laying the table, stuffing the goose.My 95 year old grandmother says she can't do much to help this year.I say grandmother is workshy and gets no XmasCoin.The system exists incentivise a more efficient Christmas celebration.We can't simply give out free handouts or no carrots will be chopped.At the dinner I manage to win 70% of my cracker pulls and sell my hats for more XmasCoins.I end up with half the XmasCoins in circulation by acting as the central bank and taking fees on every transaction.A very profitable Christmas for me, as I am the most resourceful entrepreneur.My 5 year old is crying because I bought his Lego Minecraft set.

Society is crumbling.I was in Pret a Manger & a homeless man came in & scooped all the sandwiches on display & nicked them in front of everyone.No one did a single thing.They just stood and watched.Not me though. I chased after the man.I was able to catch up to him easily because I do Parkrun.He begged me not to call the police.I didn't. I offered him a job.This man showed ingenuity by noticing a loophole in the legal system and capitalising.I offered him £75 a piece to go into coffee shops to steal the sandwiches for me.Guaranteed income for him. Cheap sandwiches for me.Every single person in that Pret stood by and watched a business opportunity sail by.What has happened to London?

Wealth inequality is a huge problem.I have 50x more wealth than the median person.But can we solve it?Let's look at another massive inequality problem.I also have 50x more women interested in me than the median man.This is a real burden, as I cannot sleep with that many women.There simply aren't enough hours in the day.Studies show that the top 20% of men are having sex with 80% of women.But we can't simply redistribute these women. Imagine if the government told these women to get with these weaker, inferior men.This is why you can't redistribute wealth. You cannot tell wealth to go to weaker, inferior people.A wealth tax is basically the same as making women partner up with bad dudes. They don't want to.I will never give away my wealth, because I believe in rights for women.

I interviewed a PERFECT candidate, except for one thing.They had a 4 year gap on their resume.When asked about it, they said:"That was when I was born. I was a baby."Weak excuse.If you aren't working, you need a good reason.What guarantee do I have as an employee that you won't simply be "born" again in 6 months time?Studies show the first 18 months of a baby is the most impactful time.A workshy baby will likely be workshy their entire life.You are never too young to enter a career in business.Bill Gates was only 19 when he started Microsoft.Age is never an excuse.

My employees often like to have a little cry during work.This is completely normal and healthy.That's why I've scheduled in "crying time".5 mins for my staff to go to the bathroom.This is a designated period to have a small cry, splash water on their face and tell themselves "I can do this" in the mirror.This is character building.Crying is just a natural process in life. You shouldn't fight it.All my workers seem to cry a lot.Who knows why? Not me. It's not my job to know.It's simply my job to give them the space to do it.Real bosses don't try to change the fact their employees go to have a cry every single day in the toilet.

Decks are important. My plumber has been round fixing the pipes for weeks.In that time, I've had several important CEOs come over on social visits.They've caught a glimpse of his handy work and thought about hiring him for their own houses.That's when I realised: my plumber is getting significant visibility for his small business.I told him that this is more important for his career than money, and he didn't need to be paid anymore.After all, in his breaks, I made him cups of tea and he would sometimes have a quick chat with some of the UK's leading entrepreneurs.This was essentially networking drinks. Some would pay a fortune for this.He got angry at my suggestion, which was shortsighted, as it was the chance to connect and engage with an influential crowd.It is a shame that some are too stubborn and not business-minded enough to agree to not be paid for their services.TL;DR I offered to pay my plumber in exposure. He spat in my face.

I pay every single one of my employees less than they deserve.It hurts me to do so.But the truth is, if any one of them asks me for a raise, I would give them one.Every day I'm waiting for them to come in and ask.But they don't. And it pains me.I lose sleep over the guilt. Why won't they just ask?!Why do they agree to work for less than they can?CEOs are dying to give our workers more money.Why don't they strike? I let Eddy stay on at my company.Now, I'm not stupid. I knew Eddy didn't have an evil twin Ricardo because Eddy cheats on his wife and commits tax fraud, so he is evil enough already.However, I do believe in second chances, and Ricardo is a perfect metaphor for that.We all deserve an "evil twin Ricardo" once in our lives.

My stepdaughter tried to put poison in my food several times. I hired her. Here's why.My second wife had a 13 year old daughter when we met. She really hated me.She knew I was deathly allergic to peanuts and sprinkled peanut shavings into my food on several occasions. I almost died.Most stepparents would ground this child, but I respected her. Why?1. It shows a solutions oriented mindset. I'd respect her less if she hated me and didn't try to kill me.2. Giving someone a job is the best way to stop them murdering you. She is then dependent on you, plus nobody has ever hated their boss.3. It highlighted a security flaw. I had been complacent in not checking my food for peanuts every meal, which left me vulnerable to my enemies.Keep your friends close, keep your stepdaughters who have almost taken your life closer. You learn more from them.

I tripped a child during an egg and spoon race. No one saw. It was exhilarating.It was our company annual picnic last week (we do it in October to avoid the busy season).We end it with an egg and spoon race for the families, and Trevor's grandson was out in front. I've never liked Trevor, so I stuck out my leg to trip the boy. I wasn't even running in the race.Instead, Wallace won - our head of accounts. Great guy. Everything was right again.I can now understand why people do insider trading. I felt a lot of immense power in that moment, being able to turn the tides of history with one measly foot. It was against the rules, but it felt amazing.Of course, I would never partake in insider trading myself, just like how I would never trip up a small boy in an egg and spoon race.😉

An ex-employee described working at my company as Sisyphean, and maybe that's only a good thing?Yes rolling that boulder up that hill is tough work, but someone's got to do it and each time you do you get stronger bigger glutes.Unlike Sisyphus though, my employees only have to roll the boulder for half the day, then they can go home and play video games.And they have something Sisyphus never got: the chance of career progression.If they push that boulder enough times, they might be allowed to oversee Sisyphus doing it instead, and punish him if he's not working.If they're lucky, they can one day be in a position to manage hundreds of Sisyphuses, making sure they are all pushing the boulder well enough, then they won't even need video games because they won't have enough free time.Suddenly, being Sisyphus doesn't sound so bad, right?

I was walking through the park carrying £10,000 in cash in a briefcase when I looked at the surface of the lake and saw another man who looked just like me, also holding a briefcase full of cash.In my excitement I reached in to grab his briefcase and in the process I accidentally dropped my own briefcase in the water."Help!" I screamed to passersby. "The lake man stole my briefcase!"A woman who was on a run immediately dived into the lake. After a few minutes she reemerged having fished it out and handed it back to me."Thank you, how can I ever repay you?" I asked, hoping my thanks was enough."Buy me dinner?" She replied, coyly.I did. She became my third wife and mother of my fifth child.Not every accident where you drop £10,000 into a lake is bad.And what about the money? Waterproof briefcase.I never make the same mistake twice.

You can make a fortune from being a professional airline bumper if you're smart.Many flights overbook and then offer passengers large amounts of compensation to get bumped. This can be as high as £10k.If you target it right, you never have to work a day in your life. All you have to do is spend 10 hours a day travelling to specific airports.I tried this in my 20s. I found a very busy flight around Christmas because that's when most people are travelling. I risked missing seeing my newborn child at Christmas to do this.There was a problem though.I was too attractive to be bumped.The flight attendant took me aside and said "sorry sir, I'll let you in on a secret. You're too hot to not be let on this plane. We only bump the ugliest passengers."Very frustrating. I wasted all this money on a ticket AND I had to go see my stupid new child.The pro-bumper life was not for me, but it can be for you if you're a total uggo.

It's true what they say: Gen Z are the most difficult generation to work with.They just do not respect authority the way their predecessors do, and that is a problem.Last month, during the staff training day, I set up an exercise that involved two employees.One was hooked up to an electric shock machine and the other had to administer increasing degrees of electric shocks without questioning why.Not a single Gen Z employee would administer the shocks, citing their "conscience" as the reason.Insanely frustrating. The software industry moves fast and sometimes you need your employee to electrocute someone without time for an explanation.What is happening to the world? How can I expect to run a business properly if my workers won't put aside their values on human rights to do exactly what I say at all times?Gen Z are just not cut out for the workplace.

One of my female employees texted this to me. This is really really inappropriate.I know lots of people feel this way about me but do NOT feel the need to tell me.I'm a very good businessman and boss, and I know that is high breeding potential to many, but you do not have to sexualise it.I'm sick of not being able to walk from the office to the bathroom without being perved on.It is inhumane and disgusting to treat sexy CEOs this way.Some days I wish I was poor so I wouldn't get constantly hit on.Please be better.

I was giving a presentation to the whole office and it switched to another tab abruptly. It was porn.I was mortified. Many were sympathetic, laughed it off and said it was just a mistake and I'm only human.I even got a few DM slides from employees who were intrigued about my habits, but I decided to keep things professional at work by not replying until I was at home.However, one employee Geoff came in to tell me he found it a bit inappropriate that I had a porn tab open at work.I fired Geoff immediately.I find being judgemental of others' innocent mistakes to be a major red flag, and it was a perfect way to root that out.The twist?I pulled up that porn tab on purpose.I wanted to weed out the prudes with their outdated "don't look at porn at work" moralism. I'd never make a rookie error like that. I've been watching porn at work for 20 years.

Having children was the worst investment decision of my life.I have had 5 children and so far they have been a large drain on my funds.I've spent collective millions feeding them, clothing them and educating them.Their return on investment is still 0% even including my 3rd son Jeffrey's lemonade stand that I took 40% of.However, this morning I was watching my 4 year old get really excited about seeing a rainbow reflection in her glass of water for the first time.She decided to draw it, which put a smile on my face.Do these little moments of joy make the money spent worth it?Still no.I want my fucking money back. She better become a famous artist now.

The office kitchen Toaster is broken.My employees have been complaining for several weeks.Last week, one of them, my Assistant Head of Marketing tried to fix it themselves.He watched several online videos and sought help from his electrician brother-in-law on Skype.While fixing it, he electrocuted himself and had to be rushed to hospital.On the way to hospital, in his injured state, he thought up a brilliant marketing campaign for our products.We immediately put that into practice and our sales rose by 15%.As he lay in his hospital bed, he hit it off with a nurse, and now that nurse is his husband.Ladies and gentlemen, I broke that Toaster on purpose.Sometimes being a great boss means doing the unexpected and seeing what happens.

When first wife left me I didn't cry.When my parents got divorced I didn't cry.When I witnessed the birth of my firstborn child I didn't cry.When my best friend died in my arms during war I didn't cry.Today, I did cry.Why?I read that the government had closed a tax loophole I was using to avoid paying as much capital gains.Thinking about all those wasted funds going to public services brought me to tears.I told some friends about this but they weren't very receptive, but I guess the world just isn't ready for a man who is in touch with his emotions.It's okay for men to cry when the world takes away something you love: untaxed profit.

I got kicked out of my friend's book launch yesterday.My friend writes mystery crime novels and is releasing a new one and threw a little party so I went along for the free wine.I actually don't like murder mysteries because I can see the ending a mile off. I got in a heated argument with the author about this.Me: "I bet you £100 I can work out who the killer is from only reading one page."Her: "which page? As long as it's the first page and not the last page you have a deal."Me: "the bet is off." My plan was to read the last page.I then tried this on someone else and they weren't as smart and agreed.I skipped to the last page but there was no hint to the killer, so I lost the bet.As I went to get my wallet from my bag someone noticed I had palmed 3 full bottles of wine.I was escorted out of the building. Sometimes you shoot for the moon and miss.

I learned a lot when my 11 year old son was abducted at sea. I always warned him not to go into the ocean, but he was too adventurous.I was determined to find him, so I went on a perilous journey, chasing the boat that took him.I met so many interesting characters along the way, including a woman with short term memory loss and a group of recovering addicts.I had lost all hope, but then a series of tip offs led me to his location.I found him in a dentist's office in the city, and he had found a lot of new friends and his confidence.It was then I realised I had been too protective of my boy, and he had now become a man.Funny, it was him who ended up teaching me an important lesson: always let your child swim in dangerous waters alone.

I go to the sexual health clinic every 2 weeks to get a regular STI test, even when I haven't had sex for a year.Why?It's important to project an image of success even when you're failing.The same is true for business. I'm not getting laid at all and the company is going into liquidation.But the important part is no one knows either of those. The truth is what you make it.

It's time to speak up against rigged raffles at charity events.I bought 25 tickets to a raffle yesterday, hoping to score big.The raffle winners were drawn by a 9 year old child which I didn't question.As the prizes started being read out, more and more started going to different volunteers of the event.Then, I realised the child was the daughter of one of the volunteers.I'd heard about this: children who were well trained in the art of sleight of hand from birth.The last straw was when the child was the winner of my most wanted prize.I called the police.I told them there were several counts of child labour, children involved in gambling and the illicit rigging of the charity raffle.When the police showed up, it caused such a commotion that I used the opportunity to wrestle the prize off the child (she had magic fingers but she was weak).I ran home, clutching my new prized Lego Minecraft set.I will always seek to call out injustice, no matter how small.

I was called into school because my 11 year old son got into trouble with his English teacher.All the kids bring in books to read at the start of the lesson. He brought in The Prince by Machiavelli.My teacher took it away from him and said it wasn't suitable for children."Why?" My son asked."Because it teaches people to gain power at any cost, which is not a good lesson.""Interesting." My son leaned back. "How did you become a teacher?""I went to university and got an education degree.""Okay. So let me get this straight, you spent several years of your life and tens of thousands of pounds, just so you can be the autocratic ruler of a small state where you can control the media and dictate what views are suitable and unsuitable? Doesn't that seem a bit... Machiavellian?"Her jaw dropped.The next day, every kid in the class brought in their own copy of The Prince by Machiavelli.

I pay my workers to have therapy.They get a big bonus if they agree to sign up to the therapist I've found.I figured this will benefit me and my company in the long run.Why?The therapist I chose isn't a therapist at all.He feeds me all their traumas and anxieties so I can manipulate them better.Steve? He hates conflict and is a big people pleaser. I make him work weekends every other week.Debra? Daddy issues. I give her the approval that a father would. She works 30% harder.Charles? Afraid of spiders. I put spider wallpaper in the toilets so he takes fewer bathroom breaks.If they ask if he's actually a therapist, he legally has to tell them, but none of them have, which is on them.Is this really a crime if they're also getting paid more and some therapy?

People have accused me of performatively reading intelligent books in public.I was reading Malcolm Gladwell's "Outliers" in a cafe, and a woman came up to me. She said,"You're not even reading that. It's upside down." I was holding it upside down."Oh you don't think I'm reading it?" I then read out three paragraphs from it while holding it the wrong way up.She looked sheepish and embarrassed, and one man from a nearby table applauded (the whole cafe would've but it was a loud cafe and we weren't shouting the exchange.)I've spent the last 5 years training this skill because reading things the right way up was no longer a challenge for me.I now sit and read like this in public to see who is close minded and who is open to new ideas.Reading normally is boring and for conventionals. Reading upside down is for true "Outliers."

"Help. I've fallen over, can you give up your weekend to come over and make me a hot stew?"You receive this text from an elderly relative - what do you do?Do you complain that's not part of your contract, or that weekend is meant to be a time of rest?No, you show up.Then why is it different when you receive a text from me, your boss, asking you to give up your weekend to come into work and make me a hot stew?Why are you okay with your grandmother pinching your cheeks and commenting on how big you've grown, but not when I do it?Why won't you love me, dress me, bathe me, like your grammy?Bosses are the elders of society and deserve tender love and care too. If you would treat them differently than your own grandmother then you are a hypocrite.

Sorry but kissing an alien is not a big deal. I would kiss this alien that Sabrina Carpenter kissed in a heartbeat. Not at all unique or interesting.Making a business deal with an alien, however? I have recently come under fire for having a 100% male upper management team. Thank you for raising this important issue.As a very successful CEO with a lot of followers, I am committed to hiring the best employees for certain jobs, regardless of gender. It just so happens that these are all men who are my best friends from university.The reality is that certain professions naturally have gender imbalances. For example, there are more CEOs called John than there are women.My conclusion is that there must be something particularly success-oriented about the name John, so I have hired a lot of people called John. It just so happens that these are all men who also went on my stag do.While I fully support the push for greater diversity in the workplace, the current ratio of male to female persons with the name John makes this very difficult. And hiring people named John is something I'll never compromise on.It's important to note that I am a very successful CEO and good looking.Criticising me is very easy if you are not any of these things. We should instead point fingers at all the women who refuse to be called John.Targeting me who is part of the solution, not the problem, is counterproductive, as I will never change.

"Explain this gap in your CV."You might think this is a gauche question for me to ask a potential hire, but it is something I need to know.Why? Why should I care?Because I need to know if you were using that period to go back in time to kill JFK.I've studied the footage. The only way JFK could've been killed was by a second gunman (or gunwoman) that must have used a time machine.Why is this important for selling antivirus software?Because time travelling to kill JFK shows:- 💡resourcefulness- 💡determination- 💡ability to follow things through- 💡ability to meet deadlines- 💡a strong belief that the timeline is what we make of itThese are all qualities I value in an employee and specifically only met if you were on the grassy knoll killing JFK.So please, in the two years between your Masters in Creative Writing and being an accountant at KPMG, were you killing JFK?

Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs is missing an important part of the equation.Meet Bob. Bob is a hardworking guy who has all his needs fulfilled.However one day I saw him take 8 extra minutes for lunch. He had some calamari squid and I decided this was unacceptable.The next day I told him to meet in the basement where he was confronted in the dark by the Squid King brandishing 8 machetes (it was me in a squid costume.)He was frightened out of his mind and I told him he must submit to the Squid King and never be late back from lunch again. He never was.Now, the legend of the Squid King permeates through my office, and everyone is a devoted follower of the Squid Doctrine.That's what Maslow failed to include in his model: cults.What monstrous deity have you invented to keep your workers in check?

My 8 year old son fell off his bike and grazed his knee.I rushed to my first aid kit but before I gave out a plaster, I asked "how are you going to pay for it?"He was screaming in pain and saying he already spent his pocket money for the week."That wasn't very smart was it? What happens if you have an accident you're not prepared for?"I told him he might have to give back his bike to pay for the plaster and he screamed about how unfair that was. Sorry, the business world is unfair.I could see he learned his lesson so I agreed to give him the plaster this time for free but he now had a choice.He could either invest 30% of his pocket money every week to pay for future medical emergencies, or the next time he suffers an accident he'd have to give up his whole bike. He took the first option.And that is how I sold my 8 year old son health insurance.

I pretended to steal my friend's 6 year old son's nose. I put my thumb between my fingers and said "got your nose.""That's not my nose. It's clearly just your thumb. Do you think I'm stupid?" he said.I could tell he was already a smart critical thinker, so I hatched a plan.I got one of my business contacts who worked in prosthetics to build a realistic looking nose, and bought a few batches of fake blood.Next time I saw him he was cocky. "Are you going to pull another stupid fake nose trick on me again?"This time I pretended to yank very hard, and pull his nose off his face. I presented him with the very realistic nose covered in blood.He began screaming and crying. His parents came rushing in, asking what the hell I did.What I did was I taught this kid an incredibly important lesson: child or not, no one ever gets the upper hand on Ken Cheng.

I was humiliated by a comedian on stage last night.I was sitting on the front row of a comedy gig and the comedian started making fun of me just because I was yelling things out during his routine and ruining his punchlines.I thought the crowd would be on my side because I make more money and was better dressed than he was.However, when I told the comedian that my watch costs more than his house, the crowd booed me?Is this what society has become? You are booed at simply for being a success?I can't help that I'm rich. I was simply born this way.Comedy used to mean something, back when it used to aim itself at the establishment, instead of hard-working multimillionaires who want expensive watches.I felt so alone in that comedy gig, without a friend in the world. But I then remembered the most important thing: I am rich. I can buy friends.

An employee asked me if he can WORK from HOME.Here's what I said."Yes. Absolutely. I'm so glad you suggested this because you are wasting time on your commute. You can start right now."He was elated and started packing things up to leave.Me: "where are you going?"Him: "you said I could work from home."That's when I told him to come with me to the 14th floor. Also I'll be expecting your £750 rent payment at the end of the month."Never, ever ask me if you can work from home.

One of my employees, Catherine, was 1 hour late for work the other day and most bosses would fire them right there.I, however, had different plans. I decided to make her think she was a ghost.Before she arrived, I ordered every single person in the office to ignore her and treat her as invisible.There is an automatic door into the office that I decided to reprogram to no longer detect her.This turned out to be impossible but I could make it manually operated from my office, so I personally watched it until she arrived and made sure she had to tailgate other people in.When she arrived at her cubicle it was covered by police do-not-cross tape and there was a massive blood stain on the carpet, as if she had died there.I also hired a creepy child (my head of HR's nephew) to also pretend to be a ghost that was the only person to see her and say things like "where is my mommy?"Eventually we got bored around lunchtime so started talking to her again. She was suitably creeped out by the whole thing and was never late again.She eventually quit, not because of this but because the bloodstain in her office proved impossible to get out. Still, I hope she learned something from this.

I bought a burial spot for my first startup company.When my first company was declared bankrupt, I held a funeral procession for it and placed an effegy of it into a casket, which got lowered into the ground. Very few people came to this.Every year now I visit the grave to leave flowers and tell it how much it taught me about business.This year there was an elderly woman also visiting her husband's grave, whom she was married to for 50 years.Her story was touching and all, but her husband was just one man, whereas my company employed 12 people and in a way, they all died when the company went under.When I told her about my lost loved one, she burst into tears."Losing Ernest was hard but it is nothing compared to what you and the world lost when Cartocopies folded. You are very brave."She got it in a way no one else did.It's a shame people don't value the lives of companies as much as actual humans, just because they don't have sentience, feelings or any physical form.RIP Cartocopies Jun 31st 2008 - Sep 1st 2009

Several years ago a previous girlfriend caught me using Tinder on my phone and was very mad.She had no right to be.This is equivalent to looking at a job advert while you're currently employed.If an employer told you that you can't do that, that would be illegal. If they checked your phone like she did, that's a breach of my privacy.She said she was trying to check the weather and saw the notification which is several nude photos.I quoted that any evidence obtained unlawfully is inadmissable in court. She said "THIS is inadmissable in court" and threw my phone out the window, which I found immature.You are legally allowed to interview for other companies even if you have a perfectly good job, just like I am legally allowed to solicit buttpics even if I have a perfectly good butt at home.Ultimately a relationship is a lot like business in which you have to adhere to the explicit terms of the contract and the law. Rachel could not understand this, like a toxic business partner.What happened to the buttpics? Reader, I married her.

My wife made me sleep in the car for a week. It taught me a lot about resilience, culpability and imperfection.We had a huge argument because I accidentally locked her out of the house by leaving the keys in the front door.She banged on the door for hours but I was playing Call of Duty with headphones in.When she eventually climbed through the slightly open kitchen window, she was livid.I understood her anger even though there was nothing anyone could have done to avoid this.Everyone makes mistakes in business and in marriage. She seemed unable to accept this.I told her "worst comes to worst, you could've slept in the car." My solutions based  mindset seemed to make her more angry.She said sleeping in the car is horrific and I replied that it isn't, and I could do it for a whole week if I had to, so that's what I did.When I came back, she was still angry even though a) I showed her I was able to accept penance and b) I was completely right about the car thing.Sometimes, like in business, a relationship just doesn't see eye to eye. It's nobody's fault. I am probably getting a divorce. But that's life. Nobody is perfect.

I get a lot of requests for feet pics on this website.It makes sense. I'm a top 10% percentile attractive top 1% percentile successful CEO.I have hundreds of messages in my inbox, some asking for them for free and some offering between £10-£500.One day I agreed to send one. Why not? Is selling feet pics any different to selling antivirus software?Amy was elated. After I got over the initial weirdness, it felt good, knowing I've made one person happy.Months later, I'm interviewing for a new position at another company. Who turns up? Why it's Amy. She takes one look at my shoes, licks her lips and hires me.Strange coincidence huh? Not really, I've been looking to work there ever since I connected with her way before she messaged me. When life hands you lemons, take pictures of your feet.Feet pics are like Christmas presents. Only ever give them to people that can enhance your career.

Mike was planning to propose to Jenny just before end of play last Friday in the office.They met 4 years ago working here when their desks were opposite each other and their love blossomed.He asked me to help out - he wanted elaborate music, and loads of fanfare, with a  big banner coming down from the ceiling. I agreed.When it came to 4:45pm, he got down on one knee to ask the question and she seemed so excited.Then the banner dropped: it had a massive expletive on it. The music played was inappropriate. Everything was botched.I purposely sabotaged it, to teach them a lesson about business.1) you always have to be prepared for things to go wrong in the workplace2) you should have waited until after end of play instead of proposing on my company time.I don't pay you to propose, Mike.

Sometimes at the end of a meeting at work, it's hard to tell when you should lean in for a kiss.I find business meetings very intimate and intense, whether it's a job interview, a performance review or an external client. This naturally leads to wanting to kiss.However, I know too well that leaning in and making them feel uncomfortable is disastrous.That's why I've invented the "I Don't Want To Be Kissed" Badge.There's a tray at the front desk that people can take them from and wear throughout the day to avoid me trying to kiss them. This should make them feel 100% safe at work.Since I introduced them, almost every single employee has started using them, especially the women. That's when you know it was a good idea.Thanks to this one simple trick, not a single person has been kissed in my office that didn't want to be.Workplace sexual harassers hate me.

How do you deal with an employee who is too into astrology?Katie who works under me is obsessed with horoscopes, checking them daily on a new hip website,demureastrobrat.com.One day I asked her to work on Saturday, but her horoscope told her to "have a light weekend for a special surprise", so she refused.I told her she can't refuse on that basis, but she said I'm not allowed to discriminate based on beliefs and threatened to sue me. Checkmate for her, or was it?That's when I did what no one would ever think of: I bought updemureastrobrat.com.Knowing she was a Gemini (courtesy of our HR department), I personally wrote the Gemini horroscopes for several weeks. They included things like"If you want to meet a special man, you better work late tonight""Promotions only bring despair; taking a paycut will bring you inner peace.""In order to find pure happiness, you must look inside yourself and sign up to a Microsoft Access course"Eventually,demureastrobrat.comran out of money and had to shut down, and it left a huge financial hole in my assets. But it was worth it though, it was worth it to win.I won, Katie.

How do you fairly slice a cake?It was Martha's birthday in the office and someone brought a cake.However, if we did it equally between everyone, all 45 of us would get a tiny amount.I brainstormed. I considered that we do it by salary, but this seemed unfair as I would get the most cake.That's when it hit me: we should do it by how much people had contributed to the cake eating process itself.Sean got 25% for baking the cake.Sally got 12.5% for going to the kitchen to get the knife.Ben got 12.5% for transporting the cake to the office.And I got 50% for taking charge of the distribution process, R&Ding how we could cut the cake, and managing everyone.Marsha got absolutely nothing as she didn't even know about the cake's existence until it was in front of her.Without me stepping in and leading the situation, everyone would've been sitting around not eating cake. Managers are the real heroes of any process.

I caught a member of my Sales team masturbating at work.I promoted him on the spot.Here's why.I was in the bathroom cubicle next to him and could hear him.Instead of being angry, I was curious so I kicked open the cubicle door and asked "hey buddy, what turned you on today?"He was shocked at first but then admitted "I just made a big sale and it made me feel good."This is the pure passion I want from every employee of mine to feel for work, so I made him my Deputy Head of Sales (the previous one seemed to never masturbate at work at all.)He was elated at this news. I gave him a pat on the back and said "ejaculate away, sir."Since then I've been keenly watching who takes bathroom breaks.If your job isn't turning you on at least once a week, why are you even working?

I sometimes play Werewolf with my co-workers.2 werewolves, 5 villagers. The werewolves have to avoid detection while the villagers must find the werewolves.I came up with an unbeatable strategy. The werewolf is trying to act as a villager, so I immediately come out and say I am a werewolf when I'm a villager, because a werewolf would never do that.It is a brilliant strategy that follows foolproof logic, even though everyone always executes me for doing this because they are logicless idiots.I've been applying this practice to the business world.For example, I once interviewed a candidate and they said "I am terrible at my job." I hired him on the spot.Why? Someone terrible at their job would be lying about being good at their job, so I surmised they must be good at their job. Perfect logic.He did turn out to be terrible at his job though and I fired him after 3 months for leaking all our customers' passwords, but the logic itself was still sound.You miss 100% of the terrible candidates you don't hire.

The story about Disney not allowing someone to sue them because they snuck a clause into the Disney Plus 1 month free trial terms and agreements is nothing new.I have been doing this as an employer and landlord for years.For example I rent a small two bedroom apartment in the centre of town to a couple, Steve and Jen.I put into the tenancy agreement that I'm allowed to use the second bedroom at any point if I'm tired or hungry.I also snuck in that if I do use it, Steve must tuck me in at night with a storybook of my choice.Furthermore, if I ever have a nightmare (which is often), I'm also allowed to knock on their door and ask if I can sleep with them that night.I do this 2 nights a week. Steve & Jen are livid, but they are bound by contract law. i take zero pleasure in doing this and hopefully this will be an important lesson:Always read the fine print, because there might be some crazy people out there looking to take advantage.

I was flying on a plane yesterday and someone collapsed. A cabin crew member asked, "Is there a doctor on the plane?!"I said yes. I have no medical experience. Here's why I did:As a CEO, you know that if your business is struggling, the worst thing you can do is cause a panic.For years, my previous company was in massive debt but it was important for the workers to stay positive, so I told them nothing.The same is true on a plane: plane morale is more important than anything, even one man's health.Plus, there was a small chance once I got to look at him, my instincts would kick in and I'd be able to help him.When I had a look, nothing was coming to me, but everyone was watching me. I gave them all a thumbs up and the plane cheered.That company in debt eventually collapsed, but my workers were optimistic until the end, and that's what matters.I hope the man eventually got the help he needed.

I was hiring for a very integral position at my company. I was down to only two candidates.They were equally qualified, both gave equally good interviews. It was impossible to decide between them. That's when I had a genius idea and called both back in.I decided to smell them.I can deduce a lot from smelling someone - it's like a sixth sense to me.For example, when I sniffed the first candidate, I got a sense he lived in an affluent neighborhood. His coffee breath smelled like the upmarket stuff rather than a chain, and there was a strong artisan bakery scent. There was a whiff of grease oil so I knew he didn't mind getting his hands dirty.He smelled good at his job.I then brought in the second candidate. When I leaned in to smell him, he freaked out. He screamed "what are you doing" and had to leave.I knew immediately he wasn't right for this position. What a shame, but sometimes you just know it's not going to work.We hired the first candidate. In business, in order to get the job you want, you need to be willing to be smelled.

"You're fired."One of the most devastating words to receive from your boss.In my first job as manager, I had to tell Jonathan he was fired for turning up to work high on cocaine.However, he pulled out a Uno Reverse card and said "Uno Reverse.""Shit," I thought. "I'm fired now." This was the worst way this could've gone.But then I remembered: we weren't playing Uno.However, I briefly felt exactly what it would be like to get fired. The pain. The confusion. The uncertainty.I couldn't do that to Jonathan, especially as he was creative enough to try the Uno play. So I rehired him.I later explained what happened to MY bosses and guess what? They fired me.So Jonathan's reverse card did work in the end. Guess we were playing Uno after all.

My 12 year old daughter got diagnosed with ADHD and I couldn't be prouder of her, but not for the reason you think.She said to me "Dad, I don't think I have ADHD but I think I can get a diagnosis in 2 years by studying for the test."Me: "No, impossible, they're trained professionals."Her: "Oh so you don't think I can achieve anything I want by working hard enough?"Me: "I guess not."Her: "I guess there's no point me studying for my GCSEs then."She had me there. So I let her try this. She researched different places to take the rest and maximised her chances by studying famous people with ADHD like Justin Timberlake and Bart Simpson.Fast forward two years and she's achieved the impossible, and she sells the ADHD meds she's prescribed on the internet to make a tidy profit too.If you work hard enough, anything is achievable.

I find trade unions very triggering.They remind me of school bullies, forming a big group and ganging up on one defenceless kid.When my employees went on strike, it felt like being 11 again.Loads of physically intimidating older boys forming a circle around me asking for my lunch money.They used to pick me because they feared my intelligence and success in lessons. Now it's my success in business as the CEO.It's the same insecurity, the same naked rage.Back then, I could tell the teacher and they would intervene. Now, the teacher (mediators, the law) is always on the bullies' side.When the bullies win, everyone cheers them on on social media.No one cheers on the scared, traumatised CEO who just got their money taken.We need that to change. We need justice.

"You are really good at business, but you are too f***ing sexy."I have been told this all the time and it has to stop.I can't help that making smart business decisions is a very sexually charged quality.It is frustrating to be ogled at while in the midst of a corporate merger, just because I am dressed smart and project success.This is a problem me and several CEOs face, and it's about time we start to speak out about it.I get so many advances from my employees all the time and it is a classic case of "inverse abuse of power."There's nothing I can do but accept the millions of compliments, it's a curse that haunts me to my core.

Do you believe that there is a Chosen One?I've seen films like The Matrix where there is a prophecy of someone so powerful they will save the world.I similarly believe there is a "Chosen One" of Social Media Marketing, who can save the world of physical media.They are someone so gifted they can write social media posts for 72 hours straight without getting tired or becoming derivative.This is why I push all my Social Media Managers to the absolute limit, with no breaks or sleep.Several have passed out, with one even needing to be sent to hospital.I thought I had found them, a true natural talent, but they turned out to just have ADHD and the ability to hyperfocus. After 36 hours they ended up in a psych ward.It'll all be worth it when I find The One. Finding true brilliance takes hard work, patience, and a few employees ending up in the psych ward.

I was about to have a zoom meeting at home when my 5 year old asked me what it was about. I told him it was important as I was about to fire an employee."But Dad, why is that such a hard thing to do?" He didn't understand, so it was time for an important learning experience.I showed him my script I had written out. As soon as I loaded up the zoom call with Paul, I told him he had to read out my script (luckily he has the reading age of a 9 year old).At first he was excited. He did well at the pleasantries - asking about Paul's wife and homebrewed beer - but when it came to the actual firing, he stumbled. He turned to me and protested "why do we have to fire Paul?! He has such kind eyes!"Paul gasped. "I'm...getting fired?" He started to break down, crying and screaming though stopping short of obscenities for my son's sake (great guy, Paul). My son said he couldn't watch but I said he MUST, because he caused this.Eventually Paul ended the zoom call himself and my son was left shivering.  He was ready to be a CEO.Coddled kids who are shielded from life's stresses grow up to be nervous, victims. Kids who are exposed to uncomfortable truths early grow up to become strong leaders who definitely never need therapy.My 5 year old became a man today.

My friend organised a bowling trip for their partner's birthday this weekend.The organiser asked people to pay £15 each upfront for the cost of booking. I told him I didnt enjoy bowling so will just come for drinks afterwards."It's okay don't worry about it, you can just come watch," he said, so I did.When I arrived they felt bad for me not taking part and insisted I join a team. I said I don't know if I'd enjoy it and they were shocked.Them: "You've never gone bowling before?"Me: "no."Them: "You have to give it a go!Me: "But I didn't pay the booking charge."Them: "Don't worry about it, I'd rather you have a new experience."I reluctantly agreed, and ended up bowling for a couple hours and had an amazing time. I even got two strikes.The truth: I actually love bowling. I've bowled a hundred times before. And if they knew that, I wouldn't have got to do it for free.Never show people your cards while a deal is still being made, even when it comes to your friends. The negotiation doesn't end on Friday afternoon.hashtag#negotiation

Happy Pride Month! 🌈 🌈 🌈Oh, Pride Month is already over, you say?Not for me. LGBTQ+ Pride is important to me every month.Now, a lot of companies have been accused of virtue signalling with empty gestures during Pride, but I can assure you we are following through, that's why:- we put up Rainbow flags around the office- I have changed my desktop wallpaper to Heartstopper- LGBTQ+ employees get optional Fridays off (unpaid)- I've started watching RuPaul's Drag Race to understand the culture- LGBTQ+ customers get 10% off our Antivirus software (if they can prove they are LGBTQ+)- I stop employees randomly at their desk to yell "PRIDE!"- LGBTQ+ employees get selected items of food for free in the café (bananas, ketchup sachets, salt)- An LGBTQ+ employee will get promoted regardless of experience or job performance- I have stopped calling people "gay" as an insult- I have committed to hiring an LGBTQ+ employee by 2026 (we don't have any yet)There's no way you can read all that and not think I'm a committed ally boss. I had a tooth removed yesterday. It hurt like hell.It made me think. Your teeth are like your employees.Ideally you'd have a perfect set, and you wouldn't have to remove any of them. Because I am a good guy, I tried to hold onto this tooth as long as I could but it just wasn't worth it.Sometimes, a tooth is damaged, and underperforming. Sometimes it's infected. Sometimes, it is sticking out and looks really ugly.That's why I had to fire Joel last month, because he was sticking out and really ugly. He was ruining photos and just had to go.Just like teeth, a team is only as strong as it's ugliest tooth, and Joel really was an ugly, ugly tooth. He was so damn ugly.It hurt like hell to lose him, but sometimes you just have to let the ugly ones go. Also, being high on drugs helped.

The 4 day working week is a big scam being propagated to make people spend more money at M&M World.Think about it.We can and do only go there on weekend, where they make most of their revenue.Who stands to benefit most from a whole extra day that I'm able to shop at M&M World? Sad to see our humble England team lose in thehashtag#Euro2024finals last night and a lot of blame has been put squarely on the manager, Gareth Southgate. Let me tell you, it is NEVER the manager's fault.England lost for one reason alone:The players did not invest enough money crypto.I went to Phil Foden and offered him a great deal on my new cryptocurrency. He outright refused. I said how about this: if I can do more keepie-uppies than you, you must invest in my crypto. Not only did I do more keepie-uppies, I was still going for 15 minutes after him, and he begged me to stop because he was bored and wanted to get an ice lolly."Okay," I said, "now you have to get some of my new coin."He said "sorry I have to go to practice" and just left. I never heard from him again.Had he invested in my coin, he would've made 20x his money back and had more confidence in the match last night.The fault of any football match loss rests squarely on the football employees. If a manager ever made a mistake, it is that they were too trusting of others to follow their vision. A chain is only as strong as its weakest link, and that link is never the CEO.

Lining up for class. Detentions. Having to ask before going to the toilet. Homework. You are never truly alone or without friends in the modern world. Here's why.One night I was feeling lonely as all my friends were busy and I wanted to hang out. I'm a very big proponent of boycotts. They are incredibly important and I will lay down my life for a cause. However I also really enjoy Eurovision.That's when I came up with an ingenious idea: boycott offsetting. If I can convince two friends to boycott it, I can still watch it guilt free and still be net +1 boycott.No one would bite. I then offered to pay two strangers £200 each, but most people thought it was a scam. That's when I knew I was ahead of my time.Suddenly, a brain wave. I had access to a whole load of employees I had direct power over and could manipulate without consequence.I found out casually who would be watching the show during the week. I then invented a fake deadline that meant two of them had to work Saturday between 8pm - 12am (I convinced them it was our Sydney clients because of the timezone). I then blocked BBC iPlayer in the office so they could not catch a glimpse of it.Voila, boycott offsetting completed. I watched Eurovision guilt free, allowing me to stick true to my principles and eat them too.Another problem solved using wit, cunning and money.

You need to find job opportunities anywhere you can.Let me tell you a story.I went into the reception of a major marketing firm to use the restroom.They were waiting for an interviewee to turn up, but that man never showed. I was watching Physical 100 with my partner, where 100 top athletes compete in tough physical challenges.The contestants accomplished impressive feats but there were too many tasks focussed on raw body strength, and no tasks that tested the physical endurance needed to be an impressive CEO of a large company.My partner kept commenting how they were very attractive but how did she know, when she hasn't seen them in a business environment?After all, being able to do weighted squats lifting 250kg would get you nowhere in a board meeting with investors or while negotiating a merger.Had I been on Physical 100, I would have an advantage that very few of them had: lots of money. I can pay an athlete to push a minecart with 1.5 tons of weights, but very few athletes could 100m hurdle their way into a Fortune 500 company.So, in many ways, the true winner of Physical 100 would be an entrepreneur. That is, of course, if things were fair, like they are in the real world.

Competition breeds innovation.That's why I enacted a strict policy in my office that an employee is eliminated on the Friday of each week, after a series of challenges, mental and physical. The winner gets a half-price coupon at Frankie & Benny's.After doing this for 6 months straight, I discovered that productivity has actually gone down. Colour me surprised. It turns out making your employees take part in a ritualistic Battle Royale on a weekly basis is bad for their morale.It's crazy that the things we take as a given aren't necessarily true once we question them.

Enough about the Forbes 30 under 30, what about the Cheng 5 under 5? I should do it more often.

I saw a snake being attacked by a pack of wild foxes, so I rescued it. When I picked up the snake to nurse it, it bit me causing excruciating pain and causing me to drop my backpack. The snake relented and let me have my backpack back. I essentially sold it a stock option.Someone who was watching approached me and said: “That snake bit you. Even in the face of danger, always be closing.

Let me tell you what I think is the most oppressed group in business: people who work in internal comms.Sure it doesn't have the pizazz of PR or the incredibly high sex appeal of marketing, but people who work in IC are human beings too.Meet Helen, she worked in IC at my old company. She saw there was a space open at a lunch table with a bunch of the PR team."Sorry Helen, this seats taken," one of the men said.She was confused, she didn't see any stuff. "By whom?""By someone not working in IC. Someone with a real job."She was so taken aback she dropped her jacket potato."Ooh ooh what you gonna do? Write an internal newsletter about it?" the man continued. "IC prick!"Then he got the others at the table to chant "IC! IC! IC! IC someone without any career advancement options!" which was hard to coordinate but still hurtful.Helen ran away crying. It should not have happened. Especially because the man who started chanting was me. I'm sorry Helen.I was a different person back then, blind to my own biases. The truth is the bullying people in IC receive is worse than any discrimination, or hate speech.And I didn't realise that, not until September 2014 when I received an internal newsletter that said someone at the company was willing to donate a kidney to someone who needed it.My son needed a kidney then. Internal comms singlehandedly saved his life. It saved mine. I owe Helen everything.Go out and hug an IC. They deserve it.

My 7 year-old daughter did the dishes last night, and picked up the cat poo in the garden. After she finished she asked me for "overtime pay".At first I was taken aback, but eventually I was happy to give it to her because it showed assertiveness.I offered her £5 per dish she washed and £10 per poo of cat she picked up, a lowly wage to not spoil my child.However, she began feeding our cat laxatives so he'd poo more, and our garden was constantly filled with it.She was now working non stop to clean dishes and pick up cat poo. She was so tired, breaking down into tears that I considered cutting her off, but it was an important lesson in the dangers of overtime pay.Eventually she started screaming that I need to take away her "overtime pay", which I did and now she is back to happily cleaning the dishes for free.I won.This is why being paid more can actually be negative, and why my employees only get half pay for working overtime and I refuse any pay rise. They're much happier this way.
